item.title: Your Christian Hate Life II
item.description:
Last week we identified the problem of hate among Christians with regards to those who don't measure up.  This week, we're going to find out how Jesus handles hate, and how we should handle it from a law and gospel perspective.

Rod Rosenbladt has been working on the problem of "Christians broken by the church" for many years now, and we agree with his assessment.  The problem, however, runs deeper than we all realize.  We hate.  We really do.  In fact, we hate MORE than the people of this world...  Imagine, the people of the light, are some of the biggest haters on the planet.

item.title: How to improve your Christian Hate Life
item.description:
Hate.  We've heard this before.  For all the talk that Christians make concerning holiness and self help, it appears that even after 2000 years the church still hasn't come to terms with this most perplexing problem.  To this day, because the majority of Christians do not properly distinguish law and gospel, people are calling all the time at each other blindly to repent of this or that or there can be no unity...  But with the Gospel, there is unity in Faith, in Baptism, in one Lord...  How do we know this is too often driven by hate?

I present for your consideration, Westboro Baptist Church.  Fred Phelps and his little congregation sound just like a lot of churches and church leaders.  But ever since someone set of an IED (Improvised Explosive Device) outside his church, Fred Phelps has made it his single obsession to let the world know that his god would not let this aggregious act go unpunished.  In fact, if you didn't already know, they don't randomly pick which funerals they want to picket, no.  They always picket the funerals of soldiers who died from being killed by and IED.  Now, I want you to imagine for a second.  For all his theological bloviating, Fred Phelps' problem winds up being tit for tat.  You tried to blow up my church, my god will blow you up. 

Really?  Is that what the Christian message is?  You attack him, God will attack you back?

item.title: Be of Good Cheer, the Judge is Coming!
item.description:
It's getting close to Advent folks.  That time of year where we celebrate the first coming of Christ while looking forward to the first coming.  Today, we're going to turn the end times on it's ear again by showing how that "terrible last day" will be the most joyous day of all times and ages.

But first, more magical thinking, more annointing of doors and windows, and more sorcery in the name of God...  yeah, it's still going on after thousands of years of being told not to.  Oh, and be sure you don't think we're talking about the cults that do this stuff.  We mean you average, run of the mill church.  Could be yours if you're not careful.

item.title: I believe it's Magic!
item.description: Today on Radical Grace Radio, we talked about what Christian Churches talked about last Sunday in lieu of Reformation day...  Magic and witchcraft.  More importanly, how Magic is incorporated by Christians when they get confused about what Magical thinking is and how dangerous it can be.  It's not about Bedknobs and Broomsticks.  It's about taking God's Holy Name and practicing magic and dark arts in his name...
item.itunes:subtitle: BedKnobs and Broomsticks and Bibles, oh my!

item.title: You're Tearing the World Apart!
item.description:
How does the Gospel appear to effect reality?  Most of the time, it looks like everything is being turned on it's ear.  In this reformation day special, we talk about the effects of the Gospel, and what there needs to be done for real reformation to occur...  He said, "what needs to be done"  Hu-hu-hu...

Rev 14:6 Then I saw another angel flying in midair, and he had the eternal gospel to proclaim to those who live on the earth—to every nation, tribe, language and people.
Rev 14:7 He said in a loud voice, “Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judgment has come. Worship him who made the heavens, the earth, the sea and the springs of water.”

Ro 3:27 Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded. On what principle? On that of observing the law? No, but on that of faith.
Ro 3:28 For we maintain that a man is justified by faith apart from observing the law.

Jn 8:31 To the Jews who had believed him, Jesus said, “If you hold to my teaching, you are really my disciples. 32 Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

          Jn 8:33 They answered him, “We are Abraham’s descendants and have never been slaves of anyone. How can you say that we shall be set free?”

          Jn 8:34 Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave to sin. 35 Now a slave has no permanent place in the family, but a son belongs to it forever. 36 So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed.

item.title: Humility! And How I achieved it!
item.description:
This edition of Radical Grace Radio is brought to you by the new book, Humility and how I achieved it by the High Reverend Gary Held.  Learn the finer points of achieving the most humble walk with God you will ever experience!

Luther did say, in all seriousness, "those who think they are humble know the least about true humility". 

We also talk about a simple subject...  one that is very difficult to master: Prayer

item.title: The Bleach Wins!
item.description: A lepers, all the time, on Radical Grace Radio.  Ever wonder if we're getting it right when we read and interpret the passages where Jesus heals the lepers?  Whether it's the 1 leper in Mark's Gospel or 10 in Luke's Gospel, there's more there than meets the eye.

item.title: Washed up watered down Faith.
item.description:
I was mistaken when I said on the air that this episode of Radical Grace Radio is still on the feed.  This was back in 2008 when the Pew Forum Report told us that Americans (this included Christians) believe that all faith and faith traditions lead to God and salvation.  One term that was used by a respondent to the poll said that we have a "Pragmatic respect" for other religions.  What on earth does that mean?

An important show.  Expect this past Sundays show soon.

item.title: Why Lutherans Baptize and how Baptists aren't baptists at all
item.description:
First up, there's the pew forum report on General Knowledge of Religion in America.  Atheists, Agnostics, Jews and Mormons scored the highest, while Bible belt Christians scored the Lowest.

http://pewforum.org/Other-Beliefs-and-Practices/U-S-Religious-Knowledge-Survey.aspx

Then, when asked what's the difference between the way Baptists baptise and how Lutherans baptise, we decided to take that on...  no one called during the show, but someone did call imediately after the show...  It just goes to show, a lot of people not only lack knowledge, but know it and are afraid to call us sometimes for fear of embarrassment.
item.itunes:subtitle: The People Die for lack of Knowledge

item.title: Tell me sweet little lies
item.description:
Anne Frank wrote:  "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart."


We have to tackle this issue, because ultimately it's the biggest lie the world tells itself.  "You good!  You just need to find a better system of government or laws that will make the difference!"  But if that were true, wouldn't we have found it by now?  After all, look at all the systems we've created over time.  We can do such great things, from sailing around the world, and flying around the world, to the moon and back.  Great achievements require great systems to accomplish them.

So what gives?

item.title: Senseless Drama (What the Gospel is not)
item.description: Here is a classic Radical Grace Radio, from the time when we were on WMEL, and topic flowed around the causes of some of the senseless Drama that goes on in our world.  How often are we tempted to grow angry, outraged, dispondent, at the events of our time and lives when we should be remembering God and His promises in Jesus Christ, our Lord?

item.title: I See People But They Look Like Trees Walking Around
item.description:
Ok, fair warning.  I sound like crap in this episode.  My voice was shot due to getting over some illness, and it frequently breaks apart.  I basically spoke in a monotone the whole time.  But still, we talked about the error of saying that 'Because Jesus is responsible for the whole world, and he's the one who created all of this, he takes responsibility for everything and takes the punishment"...  I know, it sounds weird, but that's exactly what you'll hear.  Remember, it's an error.  We don't believe this at all. 

Also, Pastor decided we couldn't let 9-11 go without talking about it...  See, there are people who say we're talking about Grace too much, so he decided to talk about sin and subjagating people...  Well, you asked for it.

item.title: God's will for my life: Today I'm sick
item.description:
We're all about God's will, but the truth is, His will is often hard, and it's not recognizable as good for me.  Like for instance, for this show, I was coming down with something, Pastor Greg was getting over something, and Pastor Gary was still suffereing from something.  In fact, as I type this, I'm getting worse, but be that as it may.

We also listen to some word/faithers teach us about Jesus being the first man to be born again, and how he suffered in hell in my place...  yup, it's weird.

item.title: Ex Christian: Broken by Spiritual Gifts?
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we talk about how the Spiritual Gifts are misapplied in such a way that Christians wind up broken and sorrowful.

There was a woman at my old church, which was a Pentacostal Church, who was scheduled to recieve her "annointing" one night after many weeks of being taught about fruits of the spirit.  All the people who attended classes came up front to be prayed over and begin speaking in tongues...  but when it came to be her turn, she didn't start speaking in tongues.  She was inconsolable.  She thought that since she didn't speak in tongues that God had rejected her!  After all, if she learns what she needs to do, and does them faithfully, but she doesn't get the annointing to speak in tongues, what could that possibly mean?

That's why we do this program.  We have no choice but to offer a corrective for stuff like this.  People's souls are riding on it.

item.title: Unrighteous Sinners, Meet a Righteous Savior!
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we decided to go back to some basics for the benefit of our new listeners.  It's not that we think they don't get it, but it's always good to go over the doctrine of Justification because this is the Gospel...

It's a message worth fighting for and one worth dying for.

item.title: Christ's resurrection: Not just blowin' in the wind
item.description: This is the Lost episode, where I was in Houston Texas for the convention back in July, and Pastor Gary was flying solo on live radio for the first time.  He talked about the historicity of the Resurrection, that it wasn't just a matter a mass halucination.  I called in from Houston, and we talked about the effects of the Gospel in history.

item.title: Religion: Check off Jedi Knight
item.description:
Our identity in Christ...  That sounds like it's the most important thing we could learn about ourselves, but we're all carrying around too much baggage to get it, unless we learn something really simple:  Power does not necessarily equal Good. 

Second thing is this:  The world religions are lying to you.  They have no power they can give you.  Nothing.  Only in Christ are you identified with power, and that power is Christ alone.

item.title: The Evil U-Boat Captain and How He's Pagan!
item.description: There's an entire generation that grew up thinking like a pagan, due to shows like He-Man and the masters of the universe...  is there a lot of difference between "holding aloft your magic sword" and "hold aloft your Bible"?  Not a lot if you expecting power to be given you from on high if you say the right words.

item.title: A Wreckless Confidence in Christ Part 2
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we first answer the error that says that Jesus is not God with Colosians 2:9, "for all the fullness of the Diety dwells in him in bodily form"...  Hmm...  Sounds like God to me.

But we have to pick up on this idea that we can have a "reckless confidence in Christ"...  Listen as Tyrel Bramwell of Reformation Underground calls in to join the discussion.

item.title: Some were foolish, some were wise.
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, Pastor Gary takes on a tour of the parable of the 10 virgins.  Pastor took the month of June off from teaching Bible study because he wanted to take some time to go over the scriptures himself and see if there was something he was missing...  and we think he found it.  You may not think so at first, but this is a law and gospel moment in the making.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Parable of the Ten Virgins

item.title: Body Gospel and the Devil's Doorway.
item.description:
So this Lay Delegate walks into a hotel room...  and he's watching tv when suddenly an infomercial for "Body Gospel" comes on...  So, for 3 easy payments of 39.95, I can get the complete set of work out dvds where I can sweat and praise God to the latest and greatest worship songs, the body Gospel stretch bands, and I don't know what else I can get!  It's amazing if you ask me!

Yeah, right.  I may be about to start my own weightloss program, but I think I'll make mine totally faith free.

item.title: Oprah Winfrey and the Goblet of Baal
item.description:
This edition of Radical Grace Radio was recorded in 2007, and hasn't been available online for over two years.  In fact, this show predates the cancelation of issues etc!  It was our first time on WWBC, we had just met Jerry, who is still our board op to this day, and pastor Gary and I sat down to practice some "necessary roughness" upon Oprah Winfrey and her psuedo gnostic flavors of Christianity. 

The program has been updated to the sound that we have today.  If you'd like a copy of the original, you can email me at Lutherandifference@gmail.com and I'll be glad to get you one.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oprah, Chopra and fried uproar

item.title: When Rome Collides with Saddleback
item.description:
Or, how I learned to stop worrying and love John MacArchur. 

Notes about Rome and Prostestantism in the 21st century.

Rome:  Sins, Confession, Absolution, Penance

Protestantism:  Sins, confess before God, give Jesus  your heart, get right with God
item.itunes:subtitle: How I learned to stop worrying and love John MacArthur

item.title: Putting a patent on Good News?
item.description:
Does that sound weird?  You bet it does!  Almost as weird as the guys on Radical Grace Radio talking about Stem Cell Research and the dangers of Embryonic stem cell implantation...  Also we've offered yet another corrective for those who insist on Lordship Salvation. 

This program was recorded before I recorded the John MacArthur Sermon Review.

item.title: John MacArthur: Sermon Review
item.description:
You know how the old hymn goes.

My hope is built on nothing less than Me and my obedience
Cause John MacArthur told me so
I know the path that I must go
On works the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand

"Now to the one who does not work, but trusts God who justifies the wicked, his faith is credited as righteousness". The Letter the Romans, the fourth chapter.

item.title: Jesus is Lord of Some?
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, John MacArthur find his way into the "error and reboot" segment of the show with some strange comments he makes from a sermon where he asserts that people can understand and even believe the Gospel and still go to hell.  As a result of all this nonsense we have no choice but to talk about "lordship Salvation" and it's damaging effects on faith.

How many of you remember this line?  "If Jesus isn't Lord of all, he isn't really Lord at all"...  I grew up with that silliness.  Why not just take a Holy Ghost Machine Gun and blow my head off?  Wait, someone said that once...

item.title: Saved by grace through love? (repost)
item.description:
This program was deleted from the feed due to it being defective.  The file came out corrupted, but this one has been fixed.

An Emailer wants to know, "am I unregenerate because I don't love like I should?"  The answer to that question isn't as intuitive as you might think.

item.title: God doesn't do anything by halves!
item.description:
Paul Washer makes his debut in the "Fatal Error" segment, and the thrust of his comments nearly slipped by at least one of the Pastors.  Unfortunately, Paul Washer is a Lordship Salvationist, who preaches that the Gospel is merely a trust and obey proposal, rather than in it's proper sense of the preaching Christ and him Crucified.

On the second half, we talk about a sign outside a Catholic Parish that says something utterly rediculous for Roman Catholics.  You'll have to listen to find out what it said.

item.title: The Law of Piety/Law of Love
item.description:
Oh the things the Word of Faithers will say to make their followers think so highly of themselves.  Pastor Fred Price provides this edition's "fatal error".

But on this edition of Radical Grace Radio we revisit the "Lukewarm Christian Test" and divide Law and Gospel this way:  which is more important?  The law of piety?  Or the law of love?

Visit Radical Grace Radio

item.title: The Lukewarm Christian Test
item.description:
Get ready to cry folks.  You don't know it yet, but by the time a true Christian gets done reading this test and taking it earnestly, they'll be on their knees begging for mercy. 

 

http://so4j.com/lukewarm-christian-test.php

10 Questions To See If You Are a Lukewarm Christian - LINKS

1 - Do Cares & Worries of This Life Dominate Most of Your Thoughts & Conversations?
2 - Do You Practice Sin on a Regular Basis?
3 - Do You "Love" The Things of This World More Than God's Word?
4 - Are You Too Busy for Jesus? What are Your Priorities?
5 - Do You Use God's Name In Vain? ('Oh My G-d?')
6 - Do You Fail to Pray Earnestly & Pray for the Lost Who Will Spend Eternity in Hell?
7 - Do You Fail to Preach the Gospel on a Regular Basis? OR Do You Hinder Others?
8 - Are You Indifferent About Your Sin? What is Your Attitude?
 9 - Do You Seek After Worldly Wealth & Fame vs Seeking First The Kingdom of God?
10-Do You Fail to Obey Jesus, and God's Word Consistently?

Copyright © By Martha Mac / SO4J.com / SO4J-TV & Video Productions

I have a question though:  Why is this list copyrighted?  That's just weird.


In other developements, we have a new sponsor, and it's an excellent way to support the show.  You should check out http://www.audiblepodcast.com/rgradio.

item.title: Judged By Our Works?
item.description:
On this edition of Radical Grace radio, we talk in the first half hour about a listener email that asks:

 

"At what point is my sin deliberate? I know I will commit tomorrow, the same sin(s)I committed today. I recite the Lord's prayer every night. I have guilt, but that doesn't matter. I know it's a sin, but yet I keep doing it. Is this not deliberately sinning against God, thus losing my salvation?"

Then on the second half of the hour we talk about Judgment day, and why it seems that scripture is of two minds with regards to how we are saved.

item.title: The Two Edged Sword of the Lord
item.description: There are two edges to God's word.  One is the law, the other is the gospel.  Not hard to distinguish one from the other but...  When do you use them?  How do you apply law and gospel?  Listen to this episode to find out.

item.title: Overdosed on the law.
item.description: Have you ever had an infection, then had a doctor mis-prescribe the wrong medicine for your infection?  This is exactly what it's like when preachers presribe too much law to you and no Gospel, or too much Gospel with no law.

item.title: Having a Reckless Confidence In Jesus
item.description:
Listen up people!  Do you have faith?  A strong faith?  How about a "reckless confidence" in Jesus as your Savior? 

Do we really need to test that?  I mean, seriously, most of us do wish we had a reckless confidence in Jesus, so here's the thing:  How many promises does God have to make to you before you trust him?

item.title: The Big "If"
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we talk about the Big if, or the words "if you" that get used way to often in a sermon these days.  Examples of "the big if"...

"If you just smile more and have a positive attitude, God will bless you mightyly"...

"God is prepared to save you by the shed blood of Jesus Christ, IF YOU repent and believe"...

I could go on and on, but I think I'll let the blog post stand.

http://lutherandifference.blogspot.com/2010/04/big-if.html

item.title: Dumbing Down the Law
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace;  what happens when people try to make the law something that's doable and the gospel is what help you do it?  You get a dumbed down law and the dumbed down gospel.

 

You know what you get when you read Psalm 119?  Some say law.  Pastor Gary doesn't think so.  Listen.

item.title: iMonk: Thanks for everything Michael
item.description: Internet Monk Michael Spencer died Monday, April 5th, after a long bout with Cancer.  In this espisode of Radical Grace Radio, we pay tribute not by talking about him, but by talking about the things HE talked about during his time as a Post Evangelical commentator.

item.title: He Is Risen to a World that's Apostate?
item.description: In this edition for Easter 2010, we talk about Jesus being risen from the dead and the importance of his resurrection, and we talk about how Christians bash each other over the head with the word "apostate" to the point that no one listens to each other.

item.title: Live from Faith Viera:
item.description: We were live at Faith Viera Lutheran Church in Viera, with an open mike taking questions.  The topic moved into "what should the Message of the Church be".  Some people think it should be a law message.  Some think it should be the Gospel (Yours truly thinks so). So we wound up talking about deception and how the law can't set those who are decieved free from lies and bondage.

item.title: Christ Lutheran:Angels and Demons
item.description: We were live at Christ Lutheran in Cape Canaveral, Pastor Greg LeSieur's Church, where Pastor Gary preached to services and we did the radio show in between.  A nice crowd turned out, and listened to us talk about Angels and Demons, which got good when we talked about the Angel of the Lord...  Jesus Christ!

item.title: Sheep and Goats and Gospel! Oh My!!
item.description:
There are people who lose thier minds over our message of Radical Grace.  Here's one.

"Lots of unbiblical stuff & personally I think your missing the mark in regards to how God said He would write the law on our hearts vs them being written on tablets of stone OT vs NT."

Confused...  St. Paul says the law is written on the hearts of all men, not just believers.  Oh well.

So today, we decided to tackle a scripture that makes people crazy by itself.  The parable of the sheep and goats.  And then we talked about Ezekiel and being a watchman.  And we're going to keep going till we've tackled every confused notion regarding Law and Gospel.

item.title: Growing up in Liberal Churches
item.description: Pastor Greg LeSieur serves as an interviewee for a segment on growing up in liberal protestant churches.  Pastor Greg has had an interesting life that took him from growing up in a liberal Episcopal church, three Seminaries and lots of heartache, and his experience in this regard is very important. ~Matthew

item.title: How do I know I'm reprobate?
item.description:
First up, we talked to Pastor Bruce Rudolf, who works with Food for the Poor, and got an update of how things are going for Haiti relief efforts.

Then we talked about a question that was asked me that morning, that tied into what we were going to talk about.  The question, "How do I know if I'm reprobate"?  Now, the only reason I can think of why someone would ask that question is if they are genuinely concerned that they themselves are reprobate. 

What does all of this have to do with Tall Ships?  Pastor Greg gives the low down on that, and Martin Jack from the UK brings us to think about people who have left churches who may also have been called Reprobate.  This and "Can you lose your salvation?", in this edition of Radical Grace Radio.

item.title: Raw Sewage and Christian Misery
item.description:
Have you ever considered False Doctrine to be like Raw Sewage?  Have you ever considered twisting your spouse's words to make them say what you want them to say?  Have you ever had a girl friend or boyfriend that you didn't know anything about?

Have you ever heard a radio show you didn't listen to?  Do you have a Savior who you haven't heard?  The implication is enormous when you consider how it is that Christians treat the faith once delivered to the saints.

item.title: The Good Works of Rescuing the Broken
item.description: Imagine for a second...  A person hears the Gospel, and find themselves wanting to do something...  Like contact a radio ministry in Florida and offer to translate the messages and sermons they do into other languages for them.  No one asked them to do it.  We're they prompted by the Law to do this?  Or was it the Gospel working in them?

item.title: How Do Lutherans Preach Good Works?
item.description: Pastor Gary Held flies solo for this special edition of Radical Grace, which is a response to the criticism that Lutherans discourage good works, and that sanctification and good works are "hot buttons" for us.

item.title: On Haiti and Good works with Matt Harrision
item.description: On this week's show, Pastor Matt Harrision of LCMS World Relief joins us to talk about Haiti, from Haiti.  We also pick up on Christians broken by the church and talk about the parable of Pharisee and the Tax collector, and the implications of Jesus' teaching on Justification.

item.title: The Pope does good works!
item.description:
A caller asked us about Pope's comments concerning Muslims getting to heaven.  The Pope had said, "Whoever seeks peace and the good of the community with a pure conscience, and keeps alive the desire for the transcendent, will be saved even if he lacks biblical faith".  I know we're beating the horse on this, but imagine for a second a person who can't live up to this statement.  Do I have a pure conscience?  Do I always seek peace?  Do I seek the good of the community? 

Also, more Pat Robertson stuff.  We always thought that the defacto leaders of evangelicalism were the likes of Rick Warren and Franklin Grahm, but it appears we were mistaken.  Most people in this world believe that Pat Robertson Speaks for all of us Christians!  But then again, after some extensive googling, I find no big name evangelicals challenging brother Pat on his statements about Haiti. 

I wonder what that means?

item.title: Pat Robertson's Magical Mystery Tour!
item.description:
Pat Robertson, wordsmith extraordinaire, purveyor of prognostication and prophet of the ages...  Hold on a second.  Don't play the ridicule game quite yet.  Each and every one of us has done something similar or said something stupid we wish we could take back.  We just don't have a nationally syndicated television program tied to Tivos around the world in which to pontificate on such things as why Haiti has such terrible things happen to it's population....

However, this is a lesson to be learned here.  Did you know God wants us to empathize with the Haitians, even if it were true that they deserved the suffering they are getting? 

No?  Maybe you'd better give a listen.

item.title: Fighting Panzer Tanks with a Butter Knife
item.description:
Continuing the topic, "The ex-Christian:  Broken by the Church?", we talk about the new atheists, who unlike the previous generation of atheists aren't so much arguing for the non existence of Jesus or God, are instead making the argument that Christianity is an immoral religion. 
Christian Churches in Koala Lampur, Malaysia, firebombed for their use of the word "Allah" in their evangelistic literature
3000 year old pottery shows ancient Biblical inscription
Brit Hume suggests to Tiger Woods that he can find forgiveness in Jesus Christ

Be the first to tell us at what time code one of the hosts mentions the title of the show and receive a free copy of "The Everlasting Angel and the Mountain of Fire", by Pastor Peter Kurowski.

item.title: The Ex-Christian: Broken by the Church?
item.description:
In "the Gospel for Those Broken By the Church", Dr. Rod Rosenbladt draws a good profile of those people we meet who have, for whatever reason, fallen out of belief in Jesus Christ as their sin bearing Savior.  In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we dig into that profile with some testimony from me and how I used to fit that profile, and to the ex-Christian out there who is still either sad or angry about what happened to them in their Christian walk...

Contact us:


Click here to leave an email
Twitter Radical Grace

item.title: The strange case of Simeon
item.description:
We have a mystery! The Game is Afoot! How did Simeon know where to find the baby Jesus? Did he have a mystical experience? It appears that, unlike Zecharius and Mary, Simeon had no supernatural visits... How could he have known? We'll let Super-sleuth and Lutheran Pastor Gary Held lead us through the clues that reveal the truth behind Simeon's knowledge of the Messiah's whereabouts!

Ban on angels, stars on county Christmas trees

Pakistan Christians celebrate Christmas in fear, Past attack, threats leave minority group feeling especially vulnerable

Gazan Palestinians to celebrate Christmas in Israel

item.title: Putting Poison in the Mouths of Chrildren?
item.description:
Poison. That's right. Poison poured into the mouths of Children... And children exposed to wild animals! Oh wait, what this means is Pastor Greg LeSeiur is back on the program and is on top of his game, and in rare form.

We also spend some time talking about "spiritual malpractice". Just let your mind grasp that for a bit and listen to the show!

Children made to sing "Allah is God" while the Christian part of the program is so vague as to leave out any reference to Jesus altogether

Mass. Father Defends Claim That Boy, 8, Was Sent Home From School for Jesus Drawing

Evangelist Oral Roberts dies in Calif. at age 91

item.title: Christians oppressed by Chinese
item.description:
There's a group out there called Conservapedia, that thinks that the Bible we have today is too liberal.  So they want to change it.  Where have we heard this before?  Also, the Chinese government has had enough of Rogue Christians who refuse to worship in the state sanctioned churches, so much so that they attacked the only mega church in China, arrested the pastors and put the worshipers in the hospital.

So, we decided to talk about the parable of the unjust judge, which Pastor Gary believes is mistitled. 

Chinese mega church attacked
http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,579979,00.html?test=latestnews

Conservative Bible translation...  these people think the bible is just too darned liberal.
http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/34270487/ns/us_news-faith/

Church selling Tiffany Stained Glass window to help fund mission.
http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/34291880/

item.title: Two Natures At War!
item.description:
There are two natures at war in the members of your flesh.  One is the old Adam, who thinks he just fine and capable of doing good that will please God, and the new man who screams out "Put on the Brakes!  I am not worthy, capable, or even remotely performing like one who bears the Image of the Almighty God!"

This is Romans Chapter 7 Stuff.  It's also Sanctification stuff, and so against modern Evangelical ideals that it makes your head spin.

item.title: How to fill your spiritual needs
item.description:
On the way up to the station today, we we're delayed due to two accidents on I95, involving what looked like ten vehicles.  Praise God it looked like no one was seriously hurt in either accident, but it sparked a conversation that we had on the air...  About how God blesses us even when things don't go like we planned, and how our physical and spiritual needs are met.

We were going to have a conversation about online church, but all the show prep went out the window when we were delayed.  We'll have the conversation next week.

item.title: God says: "Trust ME"!
item.description:
The difference between the definitions of the word "faith" that many churches and church bodies have adopted are extremely subtle.  On the one hand, many people take faith as "being optimistic", having a good attitude and such.  I remember years ago I had one of my first bosses tell me "attitude is everything", and he pretty much expected his employees to live and work by that advice.  Being young, in my very early twenties, I had no idea that life would come along and dash that advice to pieces.  Failure often comes even when we sincerely believe we'll succeed.

I recently looked at an article on Wikipedia on Fear, and there was some interesting information listed there.  The single most surprising thing I found was that teenagers these days fear, in order of most important, the following things:  terrorist attacks, spiders, death, being a failure...  being a failure?  They actually fear failure!  It's second only to death, and if we could examine the raw data I'm sure we would find that it's actually second on the list, since fear of terrorism would include fear of death, and perhaps spiders would fit that category as well.  The fear of failure is rampant in our culture, and it's likely that this fear drives nearly everything we do.  There are people who never try to succeed at anything because of fear of failure.  There are people who are overachievers because if they fail at one thing, it's not so bad because they are so successful at other things. 

And in this, we look for advice, life coaches, programs, self help books, anything that will help us with this drive to succeed and fear of failure.  But this simply isn't what our Christian faith is about.  In fact, our Christian faith tells us we are worse than failures.  We're sinners who have offended a just and holy God, who created us in His image, and because He freely chose to love us rather than destroy us, has accomplished in Jesus Christ everything we need.

Everything, people.

item.title: 2012! And Jesus was a Meanie?
item.description:
First up?  2012!

Well, that this notion of an ancient prophesy from Mayan Culture has any bearing on...  Anything.  But what does matter is that atheists are trying to use the Bible and human reason to undermine Christian faith.  Take for instance, how atheists use Mark chapter 7 verses 24 and following to "prove" that Jesus is a mean guy.  What we learned in this program is that ELCA professors and pastors also use this text to try and prove that Jesus was a sinner!  So today, with Law and Gospel as our guide, we look closely at this text to find out what Jesus was really up to.

Here's a request to our listeners.  Do you have particular texts you find difficult to understand?  Or texts that seem to say that Salvation is by works rather than by faith?  If you do, give us buzz at RadicalGraceRadio.com, email us at Lutherandifference@gmail.com, or call our listener comment line by going to the website and visiting our "contact us" page.

item.title: O death, where is thy sting?
item.description:
In the aftermath of the event at Fort Hood this past Thursday, November 5th, we're joined by Pastor Ron Meyer of Faith Viera Lutheran Church to discuss the kind of theology that gives great comfort in times of intense grief. 

When I saw the reports that afternoon concerning Fort Hood and the devastation wrought by a lone gunman, someone in the room with me asked "where was God in all of this?"  Indeed, where was He?  We answer that question, talk about just vs. unjust wars, and we talk about a grief stricken savior, weeping over the death of his dear friend, Lazarus.

item.title: The Church is Triumphant because Jesus is Triumphant!
item.description:
In this Episode, on All Saints Day, we talk about the Church Triumphant and the Gospel of Jesus Christ...  When don't we talk about the Gospel of Jesus Christ?

But in the first half we talk about the Roman Catholic Church making overtures to Anglican and Episcopal congregations allowing them to come into communion with Rome, the Anathemas of Trent, the Book of Concord, and the Thirty-nine Articles.  Can anyone be expected to compromise on the Gospel of Jesus just to be in Communion with Rome?

Rome Expects us to.  In fact, any congregation going this route is giving up more than they think they are.
item.itunes:subtitle: Little Lutheran Rambos

item.title: Reformation Day Special 2009
item.description:
Greetings everyone, and welcome to the 2009 Reformation Day Special.

Last week we spent a fair amount of time talking about Indulgences and the effect they had on the Medieval Church.  This week we talk about the Reformation in the first half hour, and in the second half hour we talk about the "radical Reformation" and how this has effect modern evangelicalism.

item.title: Evangelical Indulgences and a People in Bondage
item.description:
Let's compare:  Indulgences were a special absolution given often times for money, for the purpose of releasing a soul from Purgatory.  In Evangelicalism, people are encouraged to tithe, send seed money, and do good works to get greater blessings from God.

Aren't we appalled that they think they can buy off God like that?  It's the worst form of bondage.  Listen to this week's show.  It's in preparation for next week's program on the Reformation.

item.title: Is Jesus the Messiah?
item.description:
John Haggee wrote a book called "in Defense of Israel", where he says that Jesus didn't come to be the Messiah, that the Jewish people can't be blamed for rejecting what was never offered to them, and that the Jewish people are still saved under the old covenant. 

So we're making this program "in Defense of Jesus", because Jesus most emphatically is the Messiah.  Listen to this one, it's important stuff, as the Gospel always is important.

Questions asked:

Is Jesus the Messiah?  What happens to the Gospel when Jesus isn't the Messiah?  What's worse;  Killing 6 million Jews?  Or refusing to preach Christ and Him Crucified to them?

item.title: Special Edition: LCMS sells KFUO FM
item.description:
On October 6th, 2009, LCMS inc. sold off KFUO FM, 99.1 in St. Louis.  The station is the counterpart to KFUO AM, that is the Christian Broadcasting side of the ministry.  We talk about the potential lost by this deal as well as the potential impact.

Click here to read the report in the St. Louis Dispatch

http://www.stltoday.com/stltoday/entertainment/stories.nsf/tvradio/story/7E33989A3E2B2A87862576470047C8E1?OpenDocument#tp_newCommentAnchor

http://www.kfuo.org/

item.title: Christian Zionism and Evangelizing Jews
item.description:
What is it about Christians these days believing that the Jews are still saved under the old covenant while we are saved by Christ?  And what is it with Christians and this infatuation with Modern Israel as the fulfillment of prophecy.  I thought that Jesus was the fulfillment of all of this?

Maybe I'm wrong?

item.title: The United States: A Masonic Nation?
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we learn that the founding fathers all seemed to have shared a common religion:  Freemasonry.  Therefore, the United States must be a Masonic Nation.   Doesn't that logic follow?  It the same logic that many people use to show that the United States is a Christian Nation.

item.title: Preaching the Nation into Corruption?
item.description:
Is it possible that bad preaching of the Law is what is actually causing the apparent increase in corruption in the United States?

Here is a brief list of topics we talked about today.

1.  Contradictory statements made in Christian circles.  One Preacher tells us on the radio that God has made peace with us in Jesus Christ and that we should rest in that peace, another wants to sell you a self help tape series that teaches you how to make peace with God.

2.  How did we get here?  With the ACORN scandal in the news, the age old question about 'the good ol' days' comes back to haunt us.

3.  Is the United States a Christian Nation?

4.  Were our founding fathers actually Christian?

@RadicalGrace on twitter
RadicalGrace@live.com
www.radicalgraceradio.com

item.title: Your Prayer Life: Just like your Sex Life?
item.description:
Pastor Gary drops a bomb...  Your prayer life is a lot like your sex life.  Yes, it really is.  Riddled with the same issues.  But how to you fix this kind of problem?  Can anyone tell me how!?

Ok, we had way too much fun on this episode.  Yes, it's a bit irreverent to talk about your Prayer life and your sex life, but there is a lot that both of these have in common.  The same problems that impede intimacy in a married couples relationship also impede us in prayer.  Give a listen.

item.title: Pray the bumpersticker to end abortion?
item.description: On the way up to the station, we saw a bumpersticker that said, "Pray the Rosery to end abortion".  You know we couldn't resist talking about that on the air.  We also talk about crossing your fingers when passing through an intersection on yellow.

item.title: What Does God's Word Say?
item.description:
After last week's show on the ELCA's decision to bless the ordination of homosexual clergy, we had one caller who strongly disagrees with our stance on the issue.  We'd like to think William for being the kind of caller who, even though he disagrees with us, was kind and considerate. 

Afterwards we talked about the difference between putting a burden on people (such as many believe we want to burden homosexuals unfairly by calling their lifestyles sinful) and what it means when Jesus tells us in Luke chapter 4 when he quotes from the scroll of Isaiah:

"The Spirit of the Lord is on me,
      because he has anointed me
      to preach good news to the poor.
   He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners
      and recovery of sight for the blind,
   to release the oppressed,
    to proclaim the year of the Lord's favor."

It's one thing to try and do away with God's Law and do away with the condemnation of sin.  It's another thing entirely to be set free!

item.title: ELCA decides: Abandon God's Word
item.description: The Evangelical Lutheran Church of America, the most liberal Lutheran Church Body in the United States, has voted to abandon the Word of God and support both Same Sex Marriage and Rostered Gay Clergy.  In this edition of Radical Grace Race, we talk about the ramifications of this move, about how the media has portrayed Lutherans during this point in history, and how an incident with a Tornado that struck the Convention Center where the ELCA were meeting to discuss these issues may have been a sign from God...

item.title: The Healing of Naaman
item.description: In this Edition of Radical Grace Radio, we talk about the Healing of Naaman and talk about how Baptism is understood through this healing.  This episode was taped last week before ELCA convention, and as soon as it's available a second special edition will be made available where we talk about the ramifications of the decisions made by the Evangelical Lutheran Church of America.

item.title: Marriage and Baptism
item.description:
Did you know that married couples can learn something about how to live out their marriage by learning about Baptism and what it means?  I was surprised.  I never would have thought about this, ever!

Also, we listen to some clips from some of the very first podcasts of Radical Grace when it was known as "the Lutheran Difference".

item.title: The Gift of Baptism and Faith
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Radio we talk about how when people think of Baptism under the Law, they often count Baptism as a work.  However, Baptism is not a work, but rather a gift from God in which he gives us Christ and all his benefits.

item.title: Can a Christian Really Fall Away?
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Radio we talk about the doctrine of "Once Saved Always Saved", which is hard sometimes because it seems to some people that we are trying to take away the assurance of Salvation?  But we learned from one caller that taking this on can be beneficial and can bring even greater comfort when the believer is pointed to Christ and His Completed work.
item.itunes:subtitle: Once Saved Always Saved

item.title: Fighting the Good Fight
item.description: In this Edition of Radical Grace Radio Pastor Greg Lesieur and I talk about what Paul might mean by "fighting the good fight".  Does Paul mean fighting the fight to Holiness?  Or does he mean something else?

item.title: Running out of time
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Radio we talk about Pop Psychology and how the "Gospel" of Pop Psychology has worked it's way into the nearly every corner of the church at large.  This show was recorded over a year ago, but is still relevant for people in desperate need of the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pop Psychology and the Gospel

item.title: Decision Theology
item.description: Have you ever wondered about the free will that man is supposed to have when it comes to choosing Christ as your personal Savior?  Have you ever wondered about your own will, which seems bent on rejecting Jesus?  This show is for you.
item.itunes:subtitle: Doveland Christian Outreach get's picketed

item.title: Law and Gospel: So What?
item.description:
Sometimes, when we talk about Law and Gospel to people, there comes a point where someone says "so what".  What that means is they aren't getting how the scriptures not only contain both Law passages and Gospel passages, but that often we have a tendency as sinful, fallen people to misread Gospel passages as Law, and often get these two distinct teachings mixed up.  In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we talk about the "so what" of law and Gospel and how it drastically changes your Christian walk when you keep these two teachings distinct. 

In the second half of the hour Pastor Ron Meyr of Faith Lutheran Viera joins us.

item.title: Comfort Comfort All My People
item.description:
The opening theme for Radical Grace Radio, in it's entirety.  No, this isn't necessarily what Sunday morning worship music should sound like.  I remember getting the idea to do an upbeat version of this old Advent Hymn when I heard the Choir at Concordia Seminary in St. Louis do it as though it were a march...  The impression I got was it's a song you sing as you're carrying the Good News to "Those who sit in Darkness".  We all decided this should be the theme for the show, since most other shows already use "A mighty Fortress" as their opening theme. 

Speaking of "A Mighty Fortress", listen carefully in the second verse for a re-iteration of this famous melody.

item.title: Law is to Gospel as _________ is to Grace?
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we're taking some time to talk about Law and Gospel, a bit of a primer on this distinction that the Formula of Concord calls "that special brilliant light that serves till the end of the age that God's Word may be rightly divided".  Pastor Gary also asked an interesting question:  Law is to Gospel as ________ is to Grace?  What would you put in the blank?

Listen to the show to get the answer.

item.title: Why is Worshiping in Church in Necessary?
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace we ask the question:  Why is Worshiping in the Church necessary?  From the many excuses that people make, whether they're too busy, or whether they don't like being around hypocrites, or whether they just think the church is "after my money", we still have to remind the people of Hebrews 10:25,"Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one anotherand all the more as you see the Day approaching."

Also we do another edition of "You've heard it said", and this week we hear Pastor Adrian Rogers give us 5 things we should be doing while we wait for Jesus' return.  My little brother likes to call this kind of preaching, "3 points and a poem", which is what he's used to back home.

item.title: You have heard it said...
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, Pastor Gary Held talks about how the idea of Christians being at war is misused by some Christians, for instance, how the idea of us being Christian Soldiers fighting against the culture is bolstered by the misapplication of certain Scripture. 

We also begin what we hope will be a weekly segment, "You have heard it said", where we take some statements of popular teaching of Christian Teachers today, and do what Jesus did with them on the sermon on the mount.  This week it's Pastor Michael Youssef and what he believes is the Gospel, and how "if you believe with all your heart, God can do great things".

item.title: There's a fight brewing at Radical Grace!
item.description: Actually, what's going on is we're fighting for the doctrine of the Trinity.  It's Trinity Sunday, and we have the Athanasian Creed in mind, and it's time to set the record straight again before the full blown Modalists get their chance to mess things up...  Happily, most Modalists don't celebrate Trinity Sunday.  Strange...

item.title: God doesn't love you in slices
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio Pastor Greg does a mean Sean Connery impersonation as he makes a great point about the love of God, and we answer an emailer who wanted to know...

There's something which confuses me about Sola Fide.  If we're saved by grace alone through faith alone by Christ alone on the authority of scripture alone, why are sacraments necessary?  I'm not necessarily doubting the necessity of sacraments, I just don't understand that if access to salvation comes down to faith alone (sola), then how is it alone if a sacrament must be coupled with it?  Thank you in advance for your answer.
-Chris
Danville, Indiana

item.title: Jumpcut: One Befuddled Listener
item.description: Sandra, a listener in Melbourne Florida, called the show...  but she didn't realize exactly which show she was calling.  We're not making fun of her, it was just a funny situation.

item.title: Listener emails and Seminary experiences
item.description:
In this Edition of Radical Grace Radio we go over some listener emails, and Pastor Greg LeSeiur Tells about his days at ELCA Seminary in Gettysburg...  Where apparently he learned the Jesus is reduced to being a condiment on the burger of World Religion.  Apparently other religions are just fine, but they are better if you add Jesus...  We know, it's bad.

Larry in KY Writes

Something Matt mentioned in the last was the first time Id heard someone else really articulate it, someone whod been there once and that is the spirit of antichrist wafting in the protestant church.  I use to tell my wife back during my struggles with was Christ really for me, that dark, dark, dark time, I believe more deception and covering up of Christ occurs not so much overtly but under the guise of nice and smiles and from well meaning fellows and pastors.  Not the kind of guys youd label, thats my enemy.  Ive told her, I think weve been tainted by dispensationalism and Hollywoodwe think antichrist and Pharisees are these dark smoking back room hand wringing plotters, or the church Lady on SNL a few years back. 

But Im beginning to think thats a fake or rouse to keep us from looking at the real antichristic spirit of our age, even in the protestant church.  For the real Christ and him crucified cover uppersare not at all like that.  In a sense that would be obvious and EASY to avoidlike a thief coming at you a mile away with his gun drawn.  No now days its sold to you under nice things and generally morals we all want.  Christ is covered up more there than anywhere so that either you end up overly proud of yourself that you are doing it OR you end up in despair thinking, Im lost for sure.  If youve been in that you know what that is like and its hard to uncover.  In a sense a Hollywood Pharisee would be refreshingly easy to refute!

You all have done a WONDERFUL job of reorienting what antichrist and all involved is.  It donned on me the other day listening that it makes sense the deception even of dispensationalism.  If the devil can get the church laity to be looking for the boogy man in some political figure, he can then sneak in under the radar under morals and things whether from Rome or within the protestant church itself in general and REALLY cover up Christ.  Because we can unite with Rome around a moral issue but at the price of the Gospel itself.

Great, great, great work brotherskeep it up you have no idea how much you feed us!

_____________________________________________________________

Josh writes...

I heard the "water valve" illustration and find it to be compelling.  However, I feel that illustration still places a burden on the PERSON and not on GOD because the person can close the valve.  In working with this illustration, we all close the valve all the time.  So, how does the valve stay open for some even when they try to close it and for some it closes.  If election is truly based solely on God, then he must choose whose valve opens and whose valve closes at the end of their life.  I don't see how you can get around the fact that God elects for salvation and selects some for condemnation.  If condemnation is based on something in us denying God's offer of salvation then, by default, salvation is also based on the lack of that same thing IN US.  I don't believe you can have election for salvation from God without selection for condemnation by God as well.

_____________________________________________________________

Jason writes...

I am listening to the program on "The United States of the Beast".  Didn't Luther, Calvin, and all the Reformers point to the dynasty of the Popes as the beast of Revelation?  It seems to fit to me.  Maybe I am getting ahead of myself because I didn't get to the end yet.  Some Lutherans sound really anti-Calvinist.  Am I damned for being Calvinist?  If so let me know why before it's too late.  I love Lutherans no matter what they say.  Martin Luther rocks.  In Christ, (unless Calvinists are damned)

Jason
Just heard the end.  I agree with Luther.  Luther rocks!

item.title: The First Resurrection: Revelation 20:5
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio, we talk about literalism applied to the Revelation of Jesus Christ, we look at how Jesus interprets his Revelation, and we get a chance to talk about the consequences of believing messed up versions of End Times Teachings and how it leads us to false Gospels.

Question of the week:  Can you get a right faith from wrong doctrines?  Email us at RadicalGrace@ live.com your take on this question.

item.title: Sowing Hatred by Teaching Doctrine?
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace we take time to clarify the historic position that Lutherans have confessed concerning who or what the Anti Christ is.  We talk about what our confessions say, and about how this same spirit of Anti Christ exists not just in Rome in the form of the Holy See, but also in Evangelicalism, obscuring the Gospel just as much as Rome does.

Also, a caller challenges us on this, stating that we shouldn't be sowing hatred in a time where religious hatred is rampant in the world.

item.title: The United States of the Beast?
item.description: In this third part in a series about the End Times, we get specific about the Anti Christ, and Pastor Gary Held has a very interesting (and chilling) theory about who or what the Beast of Revelation 13 really is.  This is a must hear episode.

item.title: Re-release: Treasure hidden a field
item.description: In this re-release edition of Radical Grace Pastor Gary and I talk about the parable from Matthew 13:44, "The treasure hidden in a field".  In the discussion we talk about applying Law and Gospel to this to discover what Jesus was really telling about the kingdom.  If you've never heard of a law and Gospel interpretation before, don't miss this discussion.

item.title: The Doomsday Clock
item.description: This week on Radical Grace Pastor Greg LeSeiur joins us again to talk about end times.  This time we struggle to find Biblical reference to a 7 year tribulation...  Aaaaaand we think we found it.  Plus the doomsday clock!  Time is running out!

item.title: Wrong or Right on Left Behind
item.description: The beginning of a series on popular eschatology, Hal Lindsey, Left Behind, and Darby and his dispensationalistic end times dance. In this edition we talk about being left behind and how Jesus seems to think about this differently than popular teachers of today.

item.title: Making payments on a Free Gift
item.description: Why do people have such a tough time accepting a free gift? Very difficult question but we believe there is a simple answer.

item.title: Rick Warrens Folly
item.description:
Once saved always saved. On the one people want to us to stop putting God in a box with all this talk of doctrine. But on the other hand they put God in a box by trying to hold some doctrine over God. As though God can be held accountable to a doctrine.
Also Rick Warren and his own words about how Jesus makes up the difference between my good works and the perfection I need to stand before God and not be destroyed.

item.title: Turning a TULIP into a Tare
item.description: TULIP is a the acronym that embodies much of Calvinistic theology. In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about Calvinism and the inherent problems the believer faces when contemplating these doctrines.

item.title: Persecuted Christians
item.description:
Believe or not sometimes Christians want to be persecuted. They do. Seriously.
Also Pastor Gary tells us what he thinks is the real problem with the culture today.

item.title: Put on your Happy Faith!
item.description: In this Edition of Radical Grace we read some listener emails and we talk about that age old method Christians use to shut down talk of discernment. Judge Not Lest Ye be Judged. We will be getting to more of your emails in the future.

item.title: How can the Gospel Get things done
item.description:
Considering how often it is that people misunderstand what church is when compared businesses and corporations. On this edition of Radical Grace we talk about clarifying doctrine, what a church is, and my favorite whipping boy. The idea of the Amazing Grace of God will somehow make Christians lazy and more sinful.
John Newton, the author of the hymn Amazing Grace, understood Radical Grace.

item.title: May the Force of Faith be with you
item.description: This week on Radical Grace Pastor Greg LeSieur of Christ Lutheran in Cape Canaveral joins us as we talk about "the Force of Faith" as the Word of Faith preachers have called it. It is amazing to think that people will play so fast and loose with Holy Scripture that they can actively re write the particulars of our faith and create what amounts to a Folk Religion.

item.title: 5 steps to perfect repentance
item.description:
We at Radical Grace Radio believe that the reason there are so many Christian self help books is because Christians know deep down inside themselves that they are failing in their Christian walk. In the spirit of helping people out in this time of economic uncertainty we have compiled the best and most perfect advice available on the subject of repentance and are now offering them free of charge to our listening audience.
All we ask in return is that you commit to following these five steps daily. You must follow them perfectly. We mean it. We REALLY mean it.

item.title: What doest it mean to Repent
item.description: This Program originally aired in 2007 shortly before lent. Listen for special guest Anna Held (then age eleven) in the second half.

item.title: Dividing Law and Gospel
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about dividing Law and Gospel. We also talk about a question that was asked by one of our listeners. Did Jesus die for the sin of unbelief?

item.title: Playing Gotcha with the Law
item.description: There is a tendency of Christians today to use the law of God like a whip. Any time they catch someone in a quote sin unquote, they pull out that whip and begin lashing that someone relentlessly, beating down anyone who disagrees with them, using phrases like "you are religious" and "you are not saved" all the while. It is a game of Gotcha, the exact same game that the opponents of Christ played with him, constantly trying to entrap him in his own words and to prove that Jesus of Nazareth was a false prophet and a sorcerer rather than the living breathing Son of God.

item.title: Spiritually Crippled
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about being spiritually crippled and how God revealing that to us is just as much a radical move of grace as is His mercy and love.

item.title: How Not to take a stand
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about NOT taking a stand.

item.title: Sold Out to God
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace Radio we talk about a way that evangelicals talk about selling out to God. Its rather strange because if you really can completely give yourself to God does that mean you now no longer need Gods mercy and grace? Or do you no longer need Jesus death and blood?
The very first edition of Radical Grace Radio on our new affiliate, WMIE 91.5FM.

item.title: The Carnal Mind
item.description: Have you ever had the sinking sensation that there is something wrong Have you ever had the sinking sensation that there is something wrong with your Christian walk, but it doesnt have anything to do with your carnal desires? Theres a way in which evangelicals talk about this subject that drives us all crazy, and in this edition of Radical Grace we talk about the Carnal Mind.

item.title: Jumpcut: Apologetics
item.description: Introducing Radical Grace Jumpcut. Periodically a part of conversation that was not very relevent to the overall topic has a wonderful point that stands out on its own. In this edition of Jumpcut, we talked about the focus of apologetics.

item.title: The Morality Wars
item.description:
The Morality Wars
Of all the movements in Christian History, none have compared with the rampant Moralism that has taken root in our churches today. Where the true central article of the faith was once Christ and Him Crucified, and even such statements as Christ alone is central to all of our faith and practice used to be the norm, there has been a slow shift towards making our deeds central to our faith rather than our creeds. Where once the confession was that we believe in Jesus Christ, our Lord, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, Suffered under Pontius Pilot, was Crucified, Died, Buried, and risen on the third day, the church at large has all but abandoned this simple proclamation in favor of what is seen as Good Christian Morals. Indeed, this is the message that is too often proclaimed instead of the cross.

item.title: What Child is This
item.description: All of us at Radical Grace Radio wish you a Merry Christmas. To celebrate, this week we present the original Christmas edition of Radical Grace. Look for another edition later in the week.

item.title: Of Baptism, Wartburg Headquarters and Witness Protection
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about Baptism and Baptismal regeneration. What is the difference between the common view of Baptism in American Evangelicalism and the Biblical view of Baptism and why is it so important to understand the difference?

item.title: Of Advent, and the Spirit of Diotrophes
item.description:
Because this is the season of Advent, Pastor decided he wanted to take the hymn Comfort Comfort These My People and talk about the meaning behind the words. As many of you know, our opening bump music features this hymn and this is the focus of our ministry. We wound up talking about the Radical Grace Ministry of speaking to those who sit in darkness and speak to all Jerusalem.
We also wound up talking about a mid nineteenth century concept of The Spirit of Diotrophes, this idea that we shouldnt be causing division over such doctrines as who Jesus is and the like. This is an important discussion because we believe that this speaks to the heart of the tendency of Christians today to not want to talk about important doctrines because they believe the cause division and strife.
Sometimes sound doctrine does cause division, but better that than someone living in idolatry.

item.title: Eternal Life and Damnation
item.description:
On this edition of Radical Grace we talk about the interview with Pastor Seth Florentino who, along with his District President and Synodical President, could face time in a Philippino prison for defying an order by a Methodist Judge to give Holy Communion to a rival group of Lutherans. Does all of that sound crazy? Well, it is a bit crazy, and you can hear more about it by listening to the interview.
Before the show began Mort and absentee host Troy Curtis got into a discussion about Revelation chapter 20. The way he reads it, when people are thrown into the lake of fire they are instantly snuffed out and there is no eternal punishment. As the host of the show who is always on the lookout for the live issues of Christianity, I couldnt resist making this the topic of the show. Does brother Mort believe in Annihilationism ? And can we set him straight? Can he be transformed by the renewing of his mind? If you havent listened an episode of Radical Grace yet, now is the time to start.

item.title: Interview with Reverend Seth Florentino
item.description: Greetings and Welcome to a Special Edition of Radical Grace. Today I have the Reverend Seth Florentino of Gloria Dei Lutheran Church in the Philipines, Who has been in the middle of a controversy involving the courts in the Philipines, believe it or not, over Holy Communion. A judge wants Seth and his Synod to Practice open communion with a Rival Lutheran Group, and very likely the Judge will issue a contempt order to have Seth and two other pastors thrown in Jail. All because he stands by the word of God and the Lutheran Confessions.

item.title: Blasphemy of the Holy Spirit
item.description: Some Christians out there are still wondering what blasphemy of the Holy Spirit is and whether or not they have committed it. In this edition of Radical Grace we answer the question that seems to be a live issue for the church at large.

item.title: The Parable of the Ten Minas
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we first have a brief discussion on the word Martyr, brother Mort shows us how NOT to talk about Jesus, and the parable of the Ten Minas from Luke 19:11. Listen in amazement as Pastor Held has one of the Pastor crushing head slapping moments.

item.title: For this Purpose I have raised you up
item.description: Barack Obama has won the presidentical campaign, and in this edition of Radical Grace we talk about those who have been chosen by God to lead his people.

item.title: One Gospel One Christ
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about something a lot of people have forgotten about. Who is Jesus? After all, he asked his own disciples the very same question, and then built his Church on the answer.

item.title: Reformation Sunday Special 2008
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about Reformation Day. And Elsies cabbage rolls and German beer. And about some guy named Martin Luther

item.title: Dr. Uwe Siemon-Netto on Radical Grace
item.description: On this edition of Radical Grace Uwe Seimon-Netto joins us to talk about racial divides in the church. We also talked about how the culture seems to have had a moral lobotomy and the role of journalist in the culture as well as the state of journalism today.

item.title: This Bread that We Break
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Pastor Gary and I talk about the Eucharist. Ever since I heard a sermon by the pastor at Cornerstone Baptist Church in Orlando on this subject I have wanted to take up this topic.

item.title: Of Radical Grace, Hypocrisy and the Church
item.description:
Jerry is our board opp. Jerry asked a question. Jerry wanted to know what Radical Grace is. We told him. His spiritual life imploded.
End of Story?
We also talked about hypocrisy and how people use this as an excuse not to come to Church.

item.title: Seek the Lord while He may be found
item.description:
In this edition of Radical Grace we pick up on the topic from last week on Isaiah 55.
Also, this broadcast had a few technical issues where parts of the program were lost. If you hear some crackling sounds it is not your iPod or your computer. It is the program itself.

item.title: Cheap Grace
item.description: Is there really a problem with Cheap Grace these days? Pastor Greg Leseur of Christ Lutheran Church in Cape Canaveral joins us again as we look at the idea of Cheap Grace and talk about how this might be possible for Christians if its possible at all.

item.title: Fruits of the Gospel
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace we talk about Christian to do lists and about fruits of the spirit. Mort Walton makes a return appearance today to mark the 52nd episode of Radical Grace.

item.title: Trust God and Hang On Tight
item.description: On this edition of Radical Grace, in continuing our discussions on Sanctification we talked a bit about Luthers Smalcald Articles, in particular the Part 3 Article 3 on repentance. Pastor also pointed out some important points from Acts Chapter 6 that give us some insight into what it means to be set apart for Gods work.

item.title: The Miracle of Suffering
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace Pastor Gary and I talk about the role of suffering in Sanctification. This prograam was recorded the day before Hurricane Gustoff made landfall near New Orleans on September 1st.

item.title: The Ten Virgins
item.description: A discussion on how much glory should we give God and the parable of the 10 Virgins.

item.title: The Lost Son
item.description: In this edition of Radical Grace, we spend some time with the parable of the Prodigal Son. This fascinating look at the parable is another exercise in dividing Law and Gospel and should not be missed.

item.title: The Good Samaritan
item.description: This week on Radical Grace we talk about "Power Verses" as Evangelicals call them and look at how all too often people choose law verses rather than gospel verses. Also we take a look at the parable of the good Samaritan from a Law and Gospel perspective.

item.title: The Rich Young Ruler
item.description: This week on Radical Grace Reverand Paul Espisito of First Baptist Church in Cocoa joins us to talk about the Church falling away from the faith and the narrative of the Rich Young Ruler
